info.title: Idaptive Identity Platform API
info.description:
This site provides basic reference material for the Idaptive Identity Platform API. The API calls are grouped by category â€“ click **Show/Hide** to view or hide the list of calls for each category. Click any call to expand the information for that call, **Expand Operations** to expand the information for all calls in that category, or **List Operations** to return to list view. 
 
To  try out any of the calls:

1.      Click the **Model Schema** box to transfer the data to the payload box (or enter data in the parameter boxes).

2.      In **payload**, replace the field value-type descriptions with actual values. 

3.      Click **Try it out!** to execute the call.
 
Note that you must be logged in to execute any calls. If you are not logged in, you can see all the reference material but the **Try it out!** button is not available to call the API. 
 
Click **Model** to view a description of each field in the response or payload, and click **Model Schema** to view the schema again.
 
For more information, see [developer site](http://developer.idaptive.com).

post.summary: Change cloud user properties.
post.description:
User must be a cloud user.
            Specified user must be you, you must be a system administrator or have user management permissions.
            Specifying 'ServiceUser' will override the 'InEveryBodyRole' property if both are provided.

CmaRedirectedUserUuid.description: Idaptive mobile authenticator redirected user uuid

AccountExp.description: Account expires date/time.  You must be a system administrator or have user management permissions to change this field.

ReportsTo.description: User reports to this user UUID.  You must be a system administrator or have user management permissions to change this field.

PasswordNeverExpire.description: Does user's password expire?  You must be a system administrator or have user management permissions to change this field.

ID.description: UUID of the cloud user to change (default=current user).

InEverybodyRole.description: Is user in the Everybody role?  You must be a system administrator or have user management permissions to change this field.

post.summary: Change the state of a cloud user from disabled to active or vice versa
post.description:
• Invoke this API when you want to change the user state from disabled to active or vice versa
  • Only system administrator, users with user management rights, or the user itself can invoke this API.
  • The API will fail, if the user itself will try to change its user state.

uuid.description: The unique ID of the user. The unique ID is generated when the user is created

state.description: Boolean value to change the user state. True = Active and False = Suspended

post.summary: Get domains and organizational units.
post.description:
This API is overloaded to get domains and OUs in a domain across AD directories with and without cache
            API variations (excluding useCache variations)
            1. id = null, directoryServiceUuid = null - fetches domains seen by cloud across directory services
            2. id = null, directoryServiceUuid != null - fetches domains specified by directory service uuid
            3. id != null, directoryServiceUuid = null - failure case
            4. id != null, directoryServiceUuid != null - gets ou under domain specified by id using directory service uuid passed in

parameters.name: useCache
parameters.description: Used when loading OUs for domains to load from cache or not(variation# 4)

post.summary: Resynchronize a TOTP or HOTP token.
post.description:
Resynchronizing requires two consecutive token codes
            (which helps to ensure that the caller is in physical possesion of the token, not just of a
            single copied token code).  Assuming that the supplied token codes can be found, TOTP resync
            will compute a new interval delta value that will be stored with the token, and HOTP resync
            will find the matching counter value (always looking forward, never backward) and update
            the counter stored with the token.
            
            Caller must either own the OATH token or be an administrator

parameters.name: firstCode
parameters.description: The first of two consecutive token codes that will be used to resynchronize the token.

parameters.name: secondCode
parameters.description: The second of two consecutive token codes that will be used to resynchronize the token.

parameters.name: tokenId
parameters.description: The UUID of the token to be resynchronized.

tokenId.description: The UUID of the token to be resynchronized

Authenticates a request.
post.description:
This API is the first endpoint which should be invoked in order proceed with flows like implicit, authorization code and authroization code with PKCE flows.
  • The response_type is set to code to indicate that an authorize code should be returned.
  • This request authenticates the user and returns tokens along with an authorization grant to the client application as a part of the callback response.
  • Refer guide OAuth Flows
  • See the OAuth2 spec

parameters.name: bounce
parameters.description: This Value is used to determine if authentication has occured.

scope.description:
scopes associated with access tokens determine which claims are available when they are used to access. openid is required for authentication requests.
    Possible values:
  • openid
  • profile
  • email
  • phone
  • address
  • all
  • groups

redirect_uri.description: Callback URI where the authorization code or tokens should be sent. It must match the value preregistered in CyberArk during client registration.

code_challenge_method.description: It is the method used to derive the code challenge for PKCE flow like value 'S256'

code_challenge.description: It is the base64 URL-encoded SHA-256 hash of the code verifier

client_id.description: It is the clientId which shoul be preregistered in CyberArk.

response_type.description: It can be any combination of code, token, and id_token

• This API is used to destroy an OIDC session through RP-initiated logout with the option to redirect users to a pre-determined URL.
  • This endpoint takes an ID token and logs the user out of session if the subject matches the current session.
  • A post_logout_redirect_uri may be specified to redirect the browser after the logout is performed.
  • Refer guide here

post.description: An opaque token is validated using the this endpoint by passing the access token or refresh token via the token body parameter and returns a boolean that indicates whether it is active. If the token is active, additional data about the token is also returned. If the token is invalid, expired, or revoked, it is considered inactive. Refer complete guide here. See the OAuth2 spec https://oauth.net/2/

post.summary: Revokes the access token
post.description:
>

Once, Authorizaton is completed using any of OAuth flows then this endpoint is used to invalidate the access token or refresh token returned from the authorization endpoint.

  • Revoked tokens are considered inactive at the introspection endpoint.
  • A client may only revoke its own tokens.
  • Refer guides Revoke Token
  • See the OAuth2 spec https://oauth.net/2/

Attempt to advance the state of an authentication session.
post.description:
Use this API to advance the user authentication to authenticate the user against CyberArk Identity.

  • Once start authentication API is invoked and a user authentication session has been created successfully, the advance authentication API is invoked to further advance the user authentication process.
  • SessionId and MechanismId returned as part of the â€œ/startAuthenticationâ€ API are passed as request parameters to this API.
  • If the request to the API is successful, you can expect 'StartNextChallenge' or 'LoginSuccess' response, however the system may (at any time) return a new MFA Package which may add, remove, or change challenges.
  • For Out of Bounds (OOB) challenge, which involves an additional entity, such as a smartphone, in the authentication process. Please refer OOB Challenge
  • For MFA please refer MFA Process
  • As a response to advance authentication API, an authentication cookie (. ASPXAUTH) would be returned for the user. This cookie can be used to access the CyberArk Identity APIs on behalf of the user.
  • Failure cases typically result in an 'Undefined' error message when the tenant settings are not configured properly or a "LoginFailure' message when incorrect answers to the MFA challenges have terminated the user session (these incorrect answers may have been sent in previous calls to this API).

TenantId.description: Tenant ID received as a response to the start authentication API

Action.description:
The action to be taken with respect to the supplied MechanismId(Ex: answer to the challenge, send oob challenge, wait for oob response, etc.).
    possible actions
  • Unknown
  • Answer
  • StartOOB
  • Poll
  • ForgotPassword
  • RetryOOB

PersistentLogin.description: Flag indicating if the user's session should persist after closing the browser

SessionId.description: The session ID is retrieved from the response received from Start Authentication API.

MechanismId.description: The mechanism ID is retrieved from the response received from Start Authentication API.

Answer.description: For mechanisms that need to be answered such as password, security code, etc., provide the answers in this field

post.summary: Starts a user authentication session.
post.description:
Use this API to start the user authentication session to authenticate the user against CyberArk Identity.

  • The API gets invoked when the user wants to authenticate to CyberArk Identity and the user enters username on the login form.
  • If the user exists in CyberArk Identity cloud directory, the server returns an array of security challenges to the client, that the user must fulfill for each challenge.
  • The users responses to these mechanisms are processed via the AdvanceAuthentication endpoint.

TenantId.description: The ID of the tenant to which the user is logging in. If this field is not provided, the username must identify the tenant

Version.description: Version of the data being sent. Options: 1.0

Added.description:
List of key-value pair entities specifying questions to add. Each question entity has the following properties:
  • Key - 'QuestionText' (string, text of user question) and Value - 'Example - BirthDate'
  • Key - 'Answer' (string, text of answer) and Value - 'Example - 1st Feb 2000'
  • Key - 'Type' (string, type of question (user/admin)) and Value - 'Example - Admin'

Deleted.description: â€“ List of the unique IDs of the security questions that need to be deleted. The unique IDs are generated when the user adds the security question.

Replace.description: Replace all existing questions with this update.
